trans-unit.source: Create a Windows virtual machine with a Resource Manager template
trans-unit.target: Create a Windows virtual machine with a Resource Manager template

trans-unit.source: Use a Resource Manager template to easily create a new Windows virtual machine with PowerShell or the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: Use a Resource Manager template to easily create a new Windows virtual machine with PowerShell or the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: You can easily create a new Windows-based Azure virtual machine by using a Resource Manager template with Azure PowerShell or the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: You can easily create a new Windows-based Azure virtual machine by using a Resource Manager template with Azure PowerShell or the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: This template creates a single virtual machine running Windows in a new virtual network with a single subnet in a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: This template creates a single virtual machine running Windows in a new virtual network with a single subnet in a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Before you dive in, make sure you have Azure, PowerShell, and Azure CLI configured and ready to go.
trans-unit.target: Before you dive in, make sure you have Azure, PowerShell, and Azure CLI configured and ready to go.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a Windows virtual machine using a Resource Manager template in the Github template repository with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a Windows virtual machine using a Resource Manager template in the Github template repository with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Here are the contents of the JSON file for the template.
trans-unit.target: Here are the contents of the JSON file for the template.

trans-unit.source: Fill in an Azure deployment name, resource group name, and Azure datacenter location, and then run these commands.
trans-unit.target: Fill in an Azure deployment name, resource group name, and Azure datacenter location, and then run these commands.

trans-unit.source: When you run the New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment command, you will be prompted to supply the values of parameters in the "parameters" section of the JSON file.
trans-unit.target: When you run the New-AzureResourceGroupDeployment command, you will be prompted to supply the values of parameters in the "parameters" section of the JSON file.

trans-unit.source: When you have specified all the parameter values, the command creates the resource group and the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: When you have specified all the parameter values, the command creates the resource group and the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example.

trans-unit.source: You will see something like this:
trans-unit.target: You will see something like this:

trans-unit.source: You now have a new Windows virtual machine named MyWindowsVM in your new resource group.
trans-unit.target: You now have a new Windows virtual machine named MyWindowsVM in your new resource group.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a Windows virtual machine by using a Resource Manager template in the Github template repository with Azure CLI commands.
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a Windows virtual machine by using a Resource Manager template in the Github template repository with Azure CLI commands.

trans-unit.source: Fill in a resource group name and Azure location (such as westus for West US), remove the brackets), and then run these commands.
trans-unit.target: Fill in a resource group name and Azure location (such as westus for West US), remove the brackets), and then run these commands.

trans-unit.source: Here is an example of the Azure CLI command set for the template.
trans-unit.target: Here is an example of the Azure CLI command set for the template.
